title: Jhin's Splash Art is Wrong. His eye is on the wrong side.
body:
Ok so this has been bothering me since Jhin was released, and I am just curious as if to anyone else has noticed this.

In game, Jhin has his left eye and left arm. Same side.
He is missing his right eye, and has a mechanical right arm.

In the splash art he has his right eye, and left arm.  Different sides.
He is looking into a mirror. So yes his -left- eye is there, but since is a mirror, its actually his right eye.

It is bothering the heck out of me, and I was wandering if anyone else has noticed this?

I am hoping maybe in the future, Riot will fix it. Especially if more people point out the mistake.
They tend to do a lot of fixes on splash art (Like taking away poor Graves Cigar) and I am really hoping they fix this.

replies.body:
Hey Senyin -

It looks like this splash may have been flipped to fix better in the Champion Details Page. This isn't something we'd consider a bug, as it's common for us to flip the splash so it sits better on that page.

Its not that its flipped.

In game he has his left eye, and left arm. Both on the same side.

On the art he has his right eye, and left arm. Two different sides.

So it isn't just a simple flip. I thought the same thing at first to.

Ah, gotcha. 

I can pass thing along to splash, but it's not something we'd likely make an adjustment to.
Cool. Sorry to bother you guys. I just like drawing art and I don't know which one is the correct art now. I'm going to assume both on the left like it is in game.
No a bother. :P When I work on cosplay, I usually pull from in-game 'cause it's what I'm looking at most of the time. ^-^
